intro: Lysipomia hutchisonii, commonly known as the Andean marsh grass, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that bloom in late summer, adding a delicate floral display to its habitat. Lysipomia hutchisonii is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
